title: St Martin School informational website

requirements.text: Create a responsive multi-page school website for “St Martin School” with a top navigation and footer, including these pages/sections: Home, About, Academics, Admissions, News & Events, Contact.

quotes: Create a website for school name st Martin school

acceptanceCriteria: Site renders with clear branding for “St Martin School”.
Navigation works on desktop and mobile (hamburger menu on small screens).
Each required page/section is reachable from the main navigation.
Footer includes school name and basic quick links (nav links).

requirements.text: Implement Home page content blocks suitable for a school website: hero section (headline + short description + primary call-to-action), 3–4 highlights (e.g., Academic Excellence, Student Life, Values, Community), and a preview strip for upcoming events/news.

quotes: Create a website for school name st Martin school

acceptanceCriteria: Home page includes a hero with headline and supporting text in English.
Home page includes 3–4 highlight cards/tiles.
Home page includes a small preview area linking to News & Events.

requirements.text: Create About page content structure with placeholders: school overview, mission & values, leadership/staff teaser, and a simple timeline or milestones section.

quotes: Create a website for school name st Martin school

acceptanceCriteria: About page contains clearly labeled sections for overview, mission/values, leadership/staff, and timeline/milestones.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Create Academics page content structure with placeholders: grade levels (or departments), curriculum overview, extracurriculars/clubs, and facilities/resources.

quotes: Create a website for school name st Martin school

acceptanceCriteria: Academics page contains distinct sections for grade levels/departments, curriculum, extracurriculars, and facilities/resources.

requirements.text: Create Admissions page content structure with placeholders: how to apply steps, requirements, tuition/fees placeholder (optional), and FAQ accordion.

quotes: Create a website for school name st Martin school

acceptanceCriteria: Admissions page includes an ordered “How to apply” step list.
Admissions page includes an FAQ accordion component with at least 4 questions/answers placeholders.

requirements.text: Create News & Events page that lists sample news posts and events (static seed data on the frontend), with a simple filter toggle (All / News / Events) and detail view or expandable cards.

quotes: Create a website for school name st Martin school

acceptanceCriteria: News & Events page shows a list of items with dates and categories (News/Event).
User can filter between All/News/Events.
User can open an item to view more details (detail page or expand-in-place).

requirements.text: Implement a Contact page with a form (name, email, subject, message) that submits to the backend and shows success/error states; also show school contact info placeholders (address, phone, email, office hours).

quotes: Create a website for school name st Martin school

acceptanceCriteria: Contact form validates required fields and email format.
On submit, the form calls a backend method and shows a success message when saved.
On backend failure, an error message is shown and the user can retry.
Contact page displays placeholders for address, phone, email, and office hours.

requirements.text: Add a backend data model for storing contact form submissions (name, email, subject, message, createdAt) and expose methods to create a submission and optionally list recent submissions for debugging/admin use (no public UI required for listing).

quotes: Create a website for school name st Martin school

acceptanceCriteria: Backend provides an update method to store a contact submission with a timestamp.
Backend persists submissions across canister upgrades using stable storage patterns appropriate for Motoko.
A query method exists to retrieve recent submissions (e.g., last N) for verification/testing.

requirements.text: Establish a coherent visual theme for St Martin School and apply it consistently across pages (colors, typography, spacing, buttons, cards). Choose a classic, academic look using warm neutrals and deep greens (avoid blue/purple).

quotes: Create a website for school name st Martin school

acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across all pages (same heading styles, button styles, card styles).
Primary palette is not blue/purple.
UI looks polished on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Add generated image assets (logo/crest and homepage hero illustration) to the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the layout (header branding and homepage hero).

quotes: Create a website for school name st Martin school

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist in frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
Header displays the school logo/crest image.
Home hero section uses the hero illustration image responsively (no layout shift, appropriate object-fit).

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not modify files in frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths; compose them instead.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
nonGoals: Student/parent portals, logins, or role-based admin dashboards.
Real-time chat, push notifications, or third-party auth providers beyond Internet Identity.
External database or third-party CMS integration.

required: School crest/logo in a classic academic style with a green-and-cream palette (st-martin-crest.dim_512x512.png)
Homepage hero illustration of a welcoming school building/campus in a warm, classic academic style (st-martin-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
Seamless subtle background pattern (e.g., shield/leaf motifs) in light cream/green (st-martin-pattern.dim_1024x1024.png)
